Class ImageCompositor

  • Object
    • ImageCompositor

  • public class ImageCompositor
extends Object
    deals with overlaying graphics over Buffered Images passed to it by the media package of MVODA
    Author:
    twoode

      ImageCompositor(GFXElement graphicsToRender)
      Takes a theme name and arranges to overlay the sequence of images set as logo TODO: we can have a choice of logos probably now

      Computes what GFX to overlay over the current videoframe by passing in the current and total video timestamps
      BufferedImage overlayImage(BufferedImage image, BufferedImage overlayImage) 
      BufferedImage overlayNextImage(long vidTimeStamp, long vidDuration, BufferedImage videoFrame)
      When passed the current video's timestamp, it's total duration, and the current videoframe, will return the composited image depending on what type of compositor you've created ie: what GFX Element this object is overlaying

      • overlayNextImage

        public BufferedImage overlayNextImage(long vidTimeStamp,
                             long vidDuration,
                             BufferedImage videoFrame)
                               throws IOException
        When passed the current video's timestamp, it's total duration, and the current videoframe, will return the composited image depending on what type of compositor you've created ie: what GFX Element this object is overlaying
        Parameters:
        vidTimeStamp - target video's timestamp
        vidDuration - targer video's total duration
        videoFrame - the image to overlay
        Returns:
        the composited image
        Throws:
        IOException

      • nextFileUNC

        public String nextFileUNC(long vidTimeStamp,
                 long vidDuration)
        Computes what GFX to overlay over the current videoframe by passing in the current and total video timestamps
        Parameters:
        vidTimeStamp - current position in video
        vidDuration - total duration of video
        Returns:
        the full UNC path of the next image to overlay
